author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Tiruchi District Consumer Movement has urged the Centre to withdraw the right assigned to the petroleum companies to fix the price for petrol and diesel. A resolution adopted at its meeting held here on Sunday, urged the Centre to withdraw the recent hike in the prices of petroleum products.

Another resolution wanted Tiruverambur to be declared as a halting station for all Express trains, as Tiruverambur is a vital junction for students of National Institute of Technology – Tiruchi, employees of Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited and other major organisations. Another resolution pleaded for introduction of a day-train service between Tiruchi and Mysore.

V. Maheswaran, president of the Movement, presided over the meeting.
title: Plea to withdraw petrol price hike
